item.description:
The time is moved to 9:30 pm. I'll be there about 9:15 pm in the lobby.

"The Good, the Bad and the Weird" is a rip roaring Korean homage to Sergio Leone's spaghetti Western, The Good, the Bad and the Ugly which memorably featured Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach.

The Good (Jung Woo-sung) is a bounty hunter, the Bad (Lee Byung-hun) is a merciless bandit chief, and the Weird (Song Kang-ho) is a train robber. They vie with each other in a desert pursuit of a mysterious treasure map. That's not exactly a new idea, but the plot doesn't matter.

What's important is the dizzying wide-screen carnage. There are chases and gun battles galore, featuring a cast of thousands of men and horses and a few women, who serve mostly as eye candy.

A favorite at festivals, it became the most eagerly awaited Asian film of 2010.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: The Good, the Bad and the Weird
